00033 // The entire definition of the Controller class is contained inside this
00034 // #ifndef-#define-#endif _Controller_h_ block.  This is done to ensure that,
00035 // if someone were to include Controller.h more than once into a single file
00036 // (such as including Controller.h as well as including another file that also
00037 // includes Controller.h), then the Controller class will not be defined more
00038 // than once.  "#ifndef" means "if not defined."
00039 #ifndef _Controller_h_
00040 #define _Controller_h_
00041 
00042 //============================================================================
00043 // INCLUDE
00044 //============================================================================
00045 // These files contain declarations and definitions of variables and methods
00046 // that will be used by the Controller class.
00047 #include <OpenSim/Common/Object.h>
00048 #include "ControlSet.h"
00049 
00050 //=============================================================================
00051 //=============================================================================
00070 // The definition of the Controller class is wrapped inside this
00071 // namespace OpenSim {} block, which makes the class a part of the
00072 // OpenSim namespace, i.e., the Controller class and all its variables
00073 // and methods can only be used by a file that contains the command
00074 // "using namespace OpenSim;" or prefixes any call to a Controller class
00075 // public method or variable with "OpenSim::", e.g., the Controller
00076 // class would be referred to as OpenSim::Controller.  The advantage of
00077 // this design is that if someone defined another namespace also contained
00078 // a Controller class that is completely different from OpenSim's
00079 // Controller class, you could refer to these two Controller classes
00080 // separately even though both Controller classes have the same name.
00081 namespace OpenSim { 
00082 
00083 // This empty declaration of the Model class is necessary because we
00084 // haven't included a definition of the Model class (e.g., Model.h)
00085 // in this file, but we do use the Model class in the code below.
00086 // This way, C++ knows that Model is a class defined elsewhere and
00087 // won't throw compiler errors when it sees the identifier "Model"
00088 // used in the code below.
00089 class Model;
00090 
00091 // The entire definition of the Controller class is contained inside
00092 // this code block.  The identifier OSIMSIMULATION_API tells C++ that
00093 // the Controller class will be part of the library files exported by
00094 // the osimSimulation project.  The terms "public Object" tell C++
00095 // that the Controller class is a subclass (child) of the Object class
00096 // in OpenSim.
00097 class OSIMSIMULATION_API Controller : public Object
00098 {
